poem:
Title: "Grim Prelude to Darkness"

In Leeds they caroused, gang's tumult cloaked by night,
Bottles clashed with reckless stories, laughter's brittle echo.
Fleeting bodies promised, their desires gave into blight.
Paths that cross with wrong, in the morning's harsh sight.
A mother, a guardian, in service, shot in a fright,
In the quiet dawn echoes her life's fading echo.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Robbers partied on night before PC Sharon Beshenivsky murder, court told An armed robbery gang partied with champagne, vodka and sex workers on the eve of the raid in which PC Sharon Beshenivsky was murdered, a court has been told. Jurors heard that the men spent the night drinking at a “safe house” in Leeds and visited a brothel before the fatal shooting. Beshenivsky was shot at point-blank range when she and her colleague PC". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
